intro: Dichaetanthera cordifolia var. reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined heartleaf, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, spikelet-like flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or wetlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
